metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19947 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel through 5.4.6, there are information leaks of uninitialized memory to a USB device in the drivers/net/can/usb/kvaser_usb/kvaser_usb_leaf.c driver, aka CID-da2311a6385c. It was discovered that the Kvaser CAN/USB driver in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize memory in certain situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216

notes.Note: tyhicks> I don't think that the Fixes tag in patch is correct and that the info leaks were possible since the initial inclusion of the driver

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1111.123').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1081.92~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.84').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1051.55~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.145').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216').

linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
